PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Implementation of Network Layer of TCP/IP Suite on 8051 - IOT
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description: The project aimed to implement some layers of the Network layer(namely IP & ICMP) on the network layer over serial communication using RS232 as the underlying layer. The objective was to implement a part of the TCP/IP suite on the 8051. Implementation of a full blown TCP/IP suite would enable the 8051 to be completely conversant via the Internet and be a true part of the concept that the Internet of Things is.

•	Improved an existing app and website (http://symptomchecker.webmd.com/symptoms-a-z) used by 1M users by providing a search and scraping the required content all into one webpage (Existing app and website requires at-least 3 redirections before desired content appears)
•	Designed using AJAX, PHP, Js. Web-scraping library – simple-html-dom (php)
•	Ported to Android using Phonegap. Web scraping re-done using jsoup.

• P2P Cloud Storage Architecture that stores files in a decentralized & extremely fault-tolerant manner. 
•	It is supposed to be used in a LAN setting, developed in JAVA and employs End-to-End encryption techniques, among others to ensure confidentiality. 
•	Primary use-case is storage for backups. Java RMI used for authentication, file transfer.

Implemented front and back end. Online scavenging game in TechTatva [Technical fest of Manipal Institute of Technology]. Game where the next level is unlocked only after cracking the previous level of question. Questions are logic based and their answers can be looked up on the internet, questions are designed in such a way that answers are not found on direct look up online. More than 1600 Users.

•	Social networking platform created in C# (MySQL used for database querying)
•	Aim was to encourage interaction between students, alumni and faculty of a particular college.
•	Users could create profiles, ask/answer questions, upvote/downvote questions, chat with other users, search for other profiles, follow threads or other users etc.
•	Used various Software engineering and database concepts.

PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Using Pyramid Bidirectional Recurrent Neural Networks to Efficiently Convert Speech to Text
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description:
•	Implemented a paper by Google Brain and CMU which converts speech to text using an encoder-decoder model and a pyramidal Bi-directional LSTM network in the encoder to train the speech signal in an end to end manner. 
•	The encoder model reduces the number of inputs to be processed to over an eighth of the initial input. 
•	Labels outputs in a conditionally dependent fashion and achieves a word error rate of only 8%. 
•	Attempting to improve the same by looking into various methods.

Windows 8 Phone App - Among All India Top 10 Apps - Code.Fun.Do Microsoft Hackathon. 
One has to just point towards a poster of the event, or even maybe a newspaper clipping, or details scribbled somewhere and take a photo of it. Scanalyzer uses the Microsoft OCR Library, and isolates relevant information in the image using a combination of regular expressions. It then helps you connect the retrieved information with your everyday used Apps, by extracting the relevant information and the info gets pre-filled to save to calendar directly, add an event to your phone, call the person, save him/her as a contact, even set a reminder for the event, and jump to links.

Windows 8 app for PC - More than 2000 downloads - Top 25 Apps Microsoft Appfest Manipal
Now make learning fun for kids! A wholesome experience of playing with colors and using them to relate to day to day objects. Paint their way to learn and write with this app, using features like Draw to Learn and Draw to Write which uses handwriting recognition to improve your child's capabilities. We aim to help kids connect visually with the alphabets and make the whole learning process an enriching experience!
• Python based desktop applications, web scraping scripts and utilities.
